source.name: Non-Fungible Token Use Cases
source.instructions:
Consider the following scenarios.
In which of them should non-fungible tokens (NFTs) be used?
Select all that apply.

answers.answer: Representing unique digital artwork or collectibles
Implementing a system for in-game currencies that can be divided and exchanged
Tokenizing real estate properties, where each property is distinct
Creating a loyalty program where points can be easily transferred between users
Issuing tickets for specific seats at an event

source.guidance: This question assesses the ability to apply knowledge of non-fungible token (NFT) standards to real-world scenarios. NFTs are suitable for scenarios requiring unique, indivisible tokens like digital art, individual real estate properties, and specific event tickets. ERC-20 or similar fungible token standards are more appropriate for divisible and interchangeable assets like in-game currencies and loyalty points. Understanding these distinctions is crucial for choosing the right token standard for specific use cases in blockchain development.
source.learningObjectives: SWBAT evaluate and distinguish appropriate use cases for non-fungible token (NFT) standards based on their properties
